86
(1) On the basis of a will, a legatee has the right to claim the fulfilment of a legacy from the person on whom the will has imposed the fulfilment of the legacy.
(2) If the fulfilment of a legacy is imposed on more than one person, each of them shall bear responsibility proportionate to the portion of the estate they are bequeathed, unless it can be determined from the will that the testator wished the responsibility to be apportioned in a different manner.
(3) If the testator has not determined who should fulfil a legacy, all legal and testamentary heirs shall be obliged to fulfil it in proportion to their hereditary portion.
